resources.string: How to do it: Start in a plank position, lower your body by bending your elbows, and push back up. Benefits: Strengthens chest, shoulders, triceps, and core.
How to do it: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, bend your knees, and lower your hips as if sitting back into a chair. Benefits: Targets legs, glutes, and improves lower body strength.
How to do it: Hold a push-up position with arms straight, engaging your core and keeping your body in a straight line. Benefits: Builds core strength and stability
How to do it: Step forward with one foot, lower your hips until both knees are bent at a 90-degree angle. Benefits: Works on leg muscles and improves balance.
How to do it: Start with feet together, jump while spreading arms and legs, then return to the starting position. Benefits: Boosts cardiovascular health and full-body coordination.

How to do it: From standing, drop into a squat, kick your feet back to a plank, perform a push-up, jump your feet back, and explosively jump up. Benefits: Full-body workout, improves cardiovascular endurance.
How to do it: Start in a plank, bring one knee towards your chest, then switch legs rapidly. Benefits: Engages core muscles and elevates heart rate.

How to do it: Lie on your back, lift your legs, and perform a bicycle pedal motion with your legs while alternating touching your elbow to the opposite knee. Benefits: Targets abdominal muscles and obliques.
How to do it: Run in place, lifting your knees as high as possible. Benefits: Enhances cardiovascular fitness and leg strength.
How to do it: Sit on a chair or bench, place hands on the edge, slide your hips off, and lower your body by bending your elbows. Benefits: Tones triceps and improves upper body strength.
How to do it: Lean against a wall, slide down until your knees are at a 90-degree angle, and hold. Benefits: Strengthens quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.
How to do it: Sit on the floor, lean back at a 45-degree angle, twist your torso, and touch the floor beside you with both hands. Benefits: Works on obliques and improves core strength.
How to do it: Lie on your stomach, lift your arms, chest, and legs off the ground simultaneously. Benefits: Strengthens lower back and improves posture.
How to do it: Lie on your side, prop yourself up on your elbow, and lift your hips, forming a straight line. Benefits: Targets core muscles, particularly obliques.
How to do it: Swing the jump rope over your head and jump over it as it comes down. Benefits: Excellent cardiovascular exercise and improves coordination.
How to do it: Lie on your back, lift your legs towards the ceiling, and lower them without touching the ground. Benefits: Targets lower abdominal muscles.
How to do it: Stand on the edge of a step, raise your heels, and then lower them below the step. Benefits: Strengthens calf muscles.
How to do it: Hold dumbbells at shoulder height, press them overhead, and lower them back to shoulder height. Benefits: Targets shoulder muscles and improves upper body strength.
How to do it: Jump onto a sturdy box or platform, then step back down and repeat. Benefits: Boosts leg strength and explosive power.
How to do it: From a plank position, jump your legs wide and then back together. Benefits: Engages core and improves cardiovascular fitness.
How to do it: Step backward with one foot, lower your hips until both knees are bent at a 90-degree angle. Benefits: Targets legs and glutes, improves balance.
How to do it: Bend at the waist, holding dumbbells in each hand, and row them towards your hips. Benefits: Strengthens the upper back and improves posture.
How to do it: Sit on the ground with a bench behind you, place your upper back on the bench, and thrust your hips towards the ceiling. Benefits: Activates glutes and improves hip strength.
How to do it: Take a step forward with each lunge, walking across the room. Benefits: Works on leg muscles, enhances balance and coordination.
How to do it: Hold dumbbells at your sides, curl them towards your shoulders, and lower them back down. Benefits: Targets biceps and improves arm strength.
How to do it: Jump and switch legs mid-air while performing lunges. Benefits: Combines cardio with leg strengthening.
How to do it: Sit on a leg press machine, push the platform away, and then bring it back towards you. Benefits: Targets quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.
How to do it: From a plank position with dumbbells in each hand, row one dumbbell towards your hip while stabilizing with the other arm. Benefits: Engages core and upper back muscles.
How to do it: Bend at the waist, walk your hands forward into a plank, and then walk them back towards your feet. Benefits: Improves flexibility and targets core and upper body.
How to do it: Step to the side with one foot, bend the knee, and lower your hips while keeping the other leg straight. Benefits: Targets inner and outer thighs, improves hip flexibility.
